issue.title: [Archery] Less precise but faster default settings for "archery benchmark diff"
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9155](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9155). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The default settings for "archery benchmark" in my opinion are a bit too exhaustive in their attempt to produce high precision numbers. I suggest that the default sacrifice precision for speed, while leaving the "neurotic" / high-precision mode as something that users can opt in to. 

This would ease interactive use for developers

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9155?focusedCommentId=17142951) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This was resolved in https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/0d1b2f8e71583d4b2c6fe1d953936351403ef731. Added a `--repetitions` option
